feedback.general: The resume lacks professional polish and contains several issues that would make it difficult for an ATS to properly parse. The current internship experience (May 2024-present) appears to be in the future, which raises credibility concerns. The resume also uses passive language ('learned to work' rather than demonstrating actual accomplishments).
feedback.header: Contact information is clear, but social media links should include full URLs for better ATS parsing. The header appears twice in the document which is confusing.
feedback.experience: The internship description is vague and uses passive language. Bullet points lack specific metrics or achievements beyond the 70% improvement claim. Since the internship dates show May 2024-present (which is in the future), this raises red flags about accuracy.
feedback.projects: Project descriptions provide some technical details but lack context about your specific role, challenges overcome, or quantifiable results. They read more like feature lists than demonstrations of your capabilities.
feedback.skills: Technical skills section is basic and lacks organization or proficiency levels. Some technologies mentioned in projects (Zustand, clerk.js) aren't included in the skills section, creating inconsistency.
feedback.education: Education section is minimal with no mention of relevant coursework, GPA, or academic achievements beyond the single research paper mentioned.
feedback.achievements: Only one achievement is listed, with no details about the publication venue, impact, or your specific contribution to the research paper.

improvement_suggestions: Fix the date inconsistency in your internship (May 2024 is in the future)
Rewrite experience bullets to focus on specific accomplishments rather than what you 'learned'
Add metrics and quantifiable results to all experience and project descriptions
Expand your skills section with organization by category and proficiency levels
Include relevant coursework and academic achievements in your education section
Provide more details about your research paper publication (journal/conference name, your contribution)
Ensure consistent formatting throughout the document
Use action verbs at the beginning of each bullet point
Tailor your resume to specific job descriptions rather than using a generic format
ats_optimization_tips: Use a single-column layout for better ATS parsing
Remove any special characters or formatting that might confuse ATS systems
Ensure consistent spacing and formatting throughout
Include full URLs for social media profiles
Use standard section headings that ATS systems recognize
Spell out acronyms at least once before using them (e.g., 'User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX)')
job_match_analysis: Unable to provide meaningful job match analysis as the provided job title and description appear to be random characters rather than actual job information.
